result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter Andrew Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs of the action, DNA surchage, buy money and transport costs - all financials to be paid during extended supervision, work out payment with agent.

Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until civil rights are restored.  No possession or consumption of alcohol in any form.  No alcohol is allowed on the premises where defendant resides.    No entry or presence into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No possession or consumption of illegal drugs, illegal prescription medications, intoxicating substances or synthetic marijuana.  Def shall not use any opiates or amphetamines without prior approval of agent.
Provide DNA sample by 12-21-2017.  Complete treatment, counseling and programming and follow through as required by the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Conditions:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample on 12-21-17.
Pay DNA surcharge.
Pay buy money of $280.00
Pay transport costs of $766.90

All financials to be paid during extended supervision, work out payment plan with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol in any form.  No alcohol is allowed on the premises where defendant resides. 
No entry or presence into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No possession or consumption of illegal drugs, illegal prescription medications, intoxicating substances or synthetic marijuana.  Def shall not use any opiates or amphetamines without prior approval of agent.
